adjectives.description: infatuated (comparative more infatuated, superlative most infatuated)

entries.meaning: Foolishly or unreasoningly fond of, attracted to or in love with (someone).
examples: […]  I did not know her then, or I could never have been so infatuated as I was, to a creature so every way her inferior  […]

entries.meaning: Excessively fond of or enthusiastic about (something).
examples: Before I leave Switzerland I cannot but observe, that the Notion of Witchcraft reigns very much in this Country.  […]  The People are so universally infatuated with the Notion, that if a Cow falls sick, it is Ten to One but an Old Woman is clapt up in Prison for it  […]

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Foolish, stupid, lacking good judgement (often as a result of some external influence).
examples: […]  that people must needs be madd or strangely infatuated, that build the chief hope of thir common happiness or safetie on a single person  […]

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of infatuate
